lead_paragraph: With $100 million in federal funds allocated to improve security along the labyrinth of railroad tracks and tunnels leading to Pennsylvania Station, a top official of the Department of Homeland Security joined Senator Charles E. Schumer on a tour of the station yesterday, and both said the work was off to a good start. But Mr. Schumer warned that much more was needed.

headline.main: Schumer Praises Work for Safer Penn Station, but Wants More

abstract: Asa Hutchinson of Homeland Security Dept joins Sen Charles E Schumer of New York on tour of Pennsylvania Station to discuss security along labyrinth of railroad tracks and tunnels leading to station; $100 million in federal funds have been allocated to project, but Schumer warns that much more is needed; Amtrak, which owns and maintains station, says about $25 million has been spent since work began year ago; project has so far included installation of underground lighting, sensors, alarms, security cameras, barricades and other devices intended to protect against terrorism; photo (M)
